history.content: 198 is a generic number assigned to any DeCal

children.subject:
Cool! I'm afraid I don't know the answer, but hopefully, now someone can help. 


The UCBUGG folks are really nice too, you might want to reach out to them for help. <staff@ucbugg.com>
Oops, sorry. This'll be my first one ever. The course title is UCBUGG. Its an animation and computer graphics DeCal.

history.content:
While the two are def related, they're quite different depending on what exactly your goals are -- the way I usually phrase it is that UCBUGG, amongst other things, teaches you how to use a program like Maya to model and animate figures. 184 teaches you how to write a program like Maya (not literally, Maya is obviously super complex, but hopefully that gets the point across lol)

184 is graphics programming and UCBUGG is really a class in 3D modeling and animation; I happened to take them together so I can't say which one is better to learn first. I think in terms of the classes themselves, you don't necessarily do better in either of them by having exposure to the other first, but in terms of an overall computer graphics education, it's definitely super helpful/interesting/enlightening (???) to take both at some point :)

I know that 184 is most likely not going to be offered next semester, but I was interested in self teaching graphics using one of these two courses. I'm planning on taking UCBUGG next semester, but would it be useful for my computer graphics education in general to self teach UCBUGG or self teach 184 first?
history.subject: 184 or UCBUGG First?

history.content: I know that 184 is most likely not going to be offered next semester, but I was interested in self teaching graphics using one of these two courses.
